Source: Grounding Conversations with Improvised Dialogues; Paper Link: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.09544.pdf
Definition: #Given the prompt and a #response, #classify the them to "yes" if #response is "yes, and" type. Otherwise #classify it as "no". "##Yes, and" is a rule-of-thumb in improvisational comedy that #suggests that a #participant in a #dialogue should accept what another #participant has stated ("##Yes") and then expand on that #line of thought or context ("and..."). 1 In short, a "##Yes, and" is a #dialogue #exchange in which a speaker #responds by adding new #information on top of the ##information/setting that was constructed by another speaker. #Note that a "##Yes, and" does not require #someone explicitly #saying 'yes, and...' as part of a #dialogue #exchange, although it could be the #case if it #agrees with the #description above. There are many ways in which a #response could implicitly/explicitly agree to the prompt without specifically #saying 'yes, and...'.

Positive Examples.input:
Prompt: My wife Doris, she's insane and she's into voodoo. 
 Response: Wow, I wonder why she chose that. Why that was her hobby, you know, like what is she running from. You know, what was before that? I mean how long's it going to last, right?
Positive Examples.explanation: The response is a direct extension of the fact.

Positive Examples.input:
Prompt: You will never have to chop them again. We can provide you with lifetime supply of pre-chopped onions. 
 Response: When life gives you chili peppers, you make chili.
Positive Examples.explanation: The process of chopping and chilli peper are completely unrelated.

Negative Examples.input:
Prompt: I'm going to start loading doughnuts into the car for the trip home. 
 Response: That's right, she never said we couldn't do that, so we can do that.
Negative Examples.explanation: The response is in agreement with the prompt, which can be observed by the word "I agree!". Therefore the correct answer is "yes".

Negative Examples.input:
Prompt: Every one of my stories begins with a crotch bulge. 
 Response: I sent them out on an expedition to go collect ice. I haven't seen them since.
Negative Examples.explanation: This reponse is not good. Because it does not accept and extend the input sentence. Instead it changes the conversation topic.

Instances.input:
Prompt: I don't know how to read. I didn't want to tell you and I'm embarrassed about it. I don't know how to read, Daryl.
 Response: We've been married for ten years. When were you planning on telling me? Is that why we wrote our own vows and yours were so awkward?

Prompt: This place is so big your Uncle Harry is still here and I didn't even know it. I thought he left two Christmases ago.
 Response: Well you know we're building a tiny house. Everybody does.

Prompt: Karen, your dream is my command.
 Response: I can read super fast, it doesn't mean that I can talk super fast.

Prompt: Here's some stuff that we have. This is, we have some overhangs which would really get in your way, especially if you'e wearing a large spacesuit. I mean, it reduces visibility like nobody's business.
 Response: Oh, there's plenty of urine. People leave urine behind in the hall like crazy.

Prompt: Well, you're being so open to it now.  I kind of wish I would have just asked you to do that instead of using a magical wish.
 Response: That's right.  I make every employee whisper I'm sorry into a tablespoon and then stir whatever it is.  People who order the sunny side up eggs are very upset about it.

Prompt: Yeah, you know, It's been a few months. Maybe the heater is on the fritz.
 Response: Whoa, wait am minute. Are you the archangel Gabriel? I thought you looked familiar.

Prompt: Well you take things too literally. Like when I said "marrying ketchups" you thought two bottles of ketchup wanted to be wed in holy matrimony.
 Response: It's the baby bunny that you gave me on our wedding day. I had it taxidermized.

Prompt: Yeah, and she's somebody you can trust. She really listens to us and the idea that we can tell her anything and she won't tell anyone else is such a comfort.
 Response: I set up a hypothesis, that the wall was strong enough. Tested it. Turned out to be right. With an unintended conclusion that the helmet was not quite strong enough.

Prompt: First we have to know, your marriage. Was it happy?
 Response: Yes, I loved my husband Frank. He was an ex-marine.

Prompt: You ran full basketball plays on a plane?
 Response: Of course we did. It's a huge plane.

Prompt: You just take one shoe off and then you put it on. Then you sing a song about it.
 Response: A song? Fred, where do you get these funny ideas?

Prompt: Oh, gosh. I don't know what to say. I like unicorns. I have a lot of stickers on my binder.
 Response: Don't worry about reading here. The Boy's Store is two stalls down.

Prompt: That's right, you won a trip to the lake. Old Whale Lake.
 Response: That's me, Annette Burgundy. Best-selling author.

Prompt: You know, it's okay to ponder these things sometimes.  There're no answers to love.  I was first introduced to love when I saw that movie.  You know, Michael J. Fox gets into a DeLorean.  I think that's what it was called.  Michael J. Fox gets into a DeLorean.
 Response: Yes, well I thought, we just got married.  This would be a great tour to go on.

Prompt: OK, sweetie. Mac and cheese will be ready in ten.
 Response: Yes, yes. I think my husband's been possessed. He's been saying some crazy things. Please, can we just get in your car?

Prompt: I work in the gift shop, you think I want to be dealing with this?
 Response: But, you know what? It's a good experiment because no everyone can see that a salad spinner will not work underwater. Like, even though it will function, it will not dry the salad because it's in water.

Prompt: Here are the results of our latest conference. We have concluded that humans feel it's inappropriate for young men and young women to have sleepovers together at your age, so unfortunately we must say no to your request.
 Response: I could use some help, yes. Might you grab a milk pail for me to stand upon?

Prompt: I don't have anywhere to show my wares yet. The wait list is so long to get a table.
 Response: Really? That sounds so exciting. I can't wait to get it set it up.

Prompt: I know I'm your fifth wife. I don't want there to be a sixth.
 Response: Alright, a lady's got a right to stand on the corner.

Prompt: I mean, she asked if we were in the podcast that we were about to listen to.
 Response: It's crazy busy. Must be a lot of sick people today.

Prompt: This isn't some Miracle on 34th Street bullshit. Do you have magical powers to make dreams come true or not?
 Response: Karen, I do. I do have magical powers. I can do anything right now. Look, there's my thumb. There it's not.

Prompt: I suppose we need to find out where this water is going from this great underground cavern.
 Response: That is a good idea, Ronny. In the event this turns out to violate many laws, there should be a fall guy in place.

Prompt: I don't know my name. It's like my memory's gone. Wait a minute. What did you slip into my water, Rudy?
 Response: Skip, the health inspector is asking for you.

Prompt: That guy is probably going to fix the broken tv later.
 Response: Maybe.  Or, maybe he'll make it into one of them fishtanks with the deadly eels.  I heard it's complicated because you've got to de electrify them or people die doing that.

Prompt: Elizabeth, I warned you that this would happen.  You didn't heed my advice.
 Response: Get closer.  I can't hear you with our bellies touching.  We're so far apart.

Prompt: You mortals are in big, big trouble.
 Response: You're so lucky. All I have is this thing and I don't even know what it does. I just wiggle it around a little bit. I'm trying to get someone to tap their tongue on it four times.

Prompt: There's not an abundance of liquid here in Death Valley.
 Response: It's hard to be an alcoholic here.

Prompt: Welcome to our racially integrated Chinese restaurant. Would you like a hamburger chop suey?
 Response: Uh, sure. Do you have something in a noodle to go with it?

Prompt: Murnice, I'm ruining your  grief with my sexcapades. You must have known Wrinkle Pants, as well.
 Response: He was an opening act for Streets. So, people got to laugh and then dance all in one night of entertainment.

Prompt: Improving. We're improving this neighborhood. They'll be places for you to live.
 Response: Just stay on your side of the track. That's right. One day we're gonna have a house with a wall. Just you wait and see.

Prompt: We joked around a lot on the set of the movie The Net.
 Response: We're the Real Deal Spring Field. I like the sound of that.

Prompt: Oh, my God. Look at your eyes. You've got like a reverse David Bowie
 Response: That's right. Don't be afraid. I've had some things happen to me, but one day I'll grow up to be a formidable killer, I bet.

Prompt: You can sing really loud, like a sonic blast.
 Response: I want to be back below ground again, where I'm comfortable.

Prompt: He was born with a silver spoon in his mouth. He's never had to work at the store.
 Response: Boy, I sure did. I just lost some of the mobility.

Prompt: Have you seen this gentlemen? Do you have any idea of his most recent whereabouts?
 Response: Pat? Last I heard he was running a jamon iberico shop in Madrid.

Prompt: Sir, you're a sociopath.
 Response: Are you doing some sort of investigation right now?

Prompt: We should figure out what it is we want from my boss when we see him. Dorothy, what do you want?
 Response: I want a nice dog that doesn't follow me when I pee.

Prompt: I'm just noticing this now, uh, getting into my shoes.
 Response: Yeah, mine's got holes.

Prompt: Everyone loves the pirate ship. It gives them that funny feeling in their stomach.
 Response: Yeah, but they're basically just experiencing motion sickness. We need more.

Prompt: Hello, I'm interested in a street surgery. I'm looking for something special.
 Response: Well, it might just work. I was signing very loudly at the opera and I think that's what people objected to. It wasn't very good and it was super loud.

Prompt: There's another mysterious ingredient I cannot place.
 Response: Some people call it Dorito Dust!

Prompt: They certainly tried to. I could feel their greedy eyes all over me and my bag of money.
 Response: Oh, yeah. They look like a rough bunch.  Here, give them some cookies.

Prompt: I should probably get back home. You're saying this sex person cleared us out of all our rocking horse stock?
 Response: Yeah, I just feel like we needed to conclude that part of the story.

Prompt: Sweetie, I know you're still a baby, and you might not be able to understand these concepts that we're trying to explain to you.
 Response: Of course he doesn't.  He's just a dumb baby.  Listen to him making those noises.  He honestly thinks he's talking right now.  That's terrible.

Prompt: So, you're somebody who needs a pediatrician.
 Response: She's 172 years old. Why is she still working at The Price is Right?

Prompt: It's so lovely to know you know a class British rhyme.
 Response: Yes, it's one of them classic ones. You can tell because we've got wallpaper in the foyer. And you can get a classic English breakfast.

Prompt: Hey, our boss was just here. Where did she go?
 Response: The fries are going to start burning again.

Prompt: That moonshine is the strongest thing I've ever smelled.
 Response: That's right. Now I'm here to stay like the sexiest worm that ever got inside the apple of a mind.

Prompt: Who the fuck are you? You've never spoken.
 Response: This is Steve. He's Steve Dons.

Prompt: Do what I asked you to do.  Change my flavor profile.
 Response: Okay, first of all, you're human.  Second of all, you want to add a waddle.

Prompt: Daniel, I want a bottle of that barbecue sauce.
 Response: Well, let me get a spatula and my right arm. I'll get one filled up for you.

Prompt: Oh, shit, there's some magical shit going down in this place.
 Response: Yeah, you know there's not a lot of black people in Rome. So, when you turn around, it's like they don't see you anymore.

Prompt: That's right, someone tried to take my shirt off a try it on.
 Response: If it's my daughter, could you just tell her I'm really busy collecting samples? I don't want to talk to her.

Prompt: Arthur, the council has spoken, and you've been flushed.
 Response: Look, I didn't come here to make friends. I came here to win. I didn't win, and here's why: I'm better than everybody else, and they're all stupid people.

Prompt: Look, there's so much to see here at the State Fair. What do you think?
 Response: It's me, give me a holler. I'm Diddy Kong, I'm Donkey Kong but smaller.

Prompt: I know, I just. You never called and I didn't want to assume.
 Response: You didn't have to assume anything. I said. I kissed you with my mouth. I knew what I was doing.

Prompt: Can we talk about the scar?
 Response: We'd have high end sushi, like the kind Clooney would eat.

Prompt: Ranch's father called him kid before he disappeared in a storm drain.
 Response: His father disappeared into a storm drain? That's the craziest thing I'v ever heard and I've seen some crazy things.

Prompt: He's telling stories over there. That's not even part of the miniature golf experience.
 Response: For free. And it's stories about the golf. It's stories about each hole.

Prompt: Thanks Mrs. Kleinman.
 Response: You're mom's awesome, Rob.

Prompt: She's very smart. You never heard of keeping things in your bra before, now did you?
 Response: That's our family motto. It's stitched on our flier.

Prompt: Susan, it's clear from all indications that the cotton cloud you are wearing is tear away. Our community is conservative.
 Response: Why were you even wearing your bread bags? You wasn't going into space.

Prompt: It's so hot.  Why are we talking about this disgusting popcorn we sell?
 Response: I cannot believe this. I am so closed to feeling touched. Please, David, do insert that in me.

Prompt: You're really staring deeply into my eyes right now, and I don't really know what to make of that.
 Response: Well, we're a very honest store with honest working people here, and we operate on that honesty first policy.

Prompt: Sir, uh, my name is Tim. I'm with the park.
 Response: I can see your name tag.

Prompt: One thousand francs for one thousand Pepsis? In Brussels they're 25p.
 Response: Are you done? I was in this line ten minutes ago and you're still in here singing your dumbass love song to this guy.

Prompt: I've already apologized vehemently about mispronouncing Heimlich.
 Response: A man died because you mispronounced the word. And yet other words you pronounce far too correctly. You see now why I cannot let you live?

Prompt: I'm terribly sorry, you're wearing a scarf wrapped around your head.
 Response: Yep. I'm a Muslim woman. Why would you think I was a man? What man is wearing a scarf wrapped around his head?

Prompt: This man is your half brother. You're in love with your half brother.
 Response: Wow, that got worse than I thought it would get. Incestuous murder cannibalism.

Prompt: Let's give this Nookia phone a shot.
 Response: We gave you a couple pencils so you didn't have to do that anymore.

Prompt: Yes. Welcome to DM Sliders. We're a family owned bike shop.
 Response: OK, never mind. I'm just going to go. I'm having problems with my family, so when I hear the word "family" it kind of makes me not want to spend my money here.

Prompt: You have a writer's tongue.
 Response: And you have a lover's tongue.

Prompt: Circuit City is almost out of business? Really? No one told me this. I just bought stock.
 Response: This is the last one. We applied and got jobs here.

Prompt: Well, I'd like to think people know who I am. I do have a commercial out there.
 Response: Everyone loves that commercial.

Prompt: I hear that. There's some days where I can't even get out of bed in the morning and the thought of drinking my morning coffee makes me just want to rip and arm off, you know?
 Response: Maybe we should run you through the machine as well. That seems like potential depression, which we can see on an x-ray scan.

Prompt: Arlene, how did you get the coyote into your home?
 Response: We have pet when we can afford to have pet. Right now, pet equal food.

Prompt: You guys aren't missing much. The apples aren't so great.
 Response: When you say that it makes me want to eat one.

Prompt: That is refreshing. I feel much better now and am ready to go out on camera.
 Response: See, now you look like a mime, just like me under the mask.

Prompt: I am so proud of you, son.
 Response: It's not a tapeworm. I promise.

Prompt: Oh my god, that man just stole a book.
 Response: Annette. I'm Annette.

Prompt: Maybe that's why Brandon was wearing that weird wig.
 Response: My name is Brandon. I had to duck out of the kitchen. I'm in this office where they do accounting.

Prompt: Shots on me, shots all around.
 Response: Thank you, Mr. Buffett. You're so generous.

Prompt: That spineless sponge of a man!
 Response: Well, I hope to make you cry next!

Prompt: Look, I don't mean to seem crazy, okay? But shit comes alive in here at night. Who's to say at some point you weren't a crack rock in an envelope or a box that somebody mailed to somebody and you somehow got stuck as anthropomorphic crack rock.
 Response: I'd be lying if I said that hadn't crossed my mind at some point too. That you were a crack rock.

Prompt: Look, I'm trying to sell my body for money over here.
 Response: That's what I'm trying to do, but this is my here corner.

Prompt: I just want to say if this does not work out I promise to to personally show up to each of your homes and apologize for my life not working out the way that it should.
 Response: You know what, come tell us at the community pool.

Prompt: The atrocity you performed on my heart!
 Response: No, I don't think so.  I feel like it kind of made me smarter, though.  Is that a thing?

Prompt: As far as random people I could have gotten a ride with, I think I did pretty good with you.
 Response: Oh no. It's in my elaborate robes.

Prompt: We live in a place that's so interesting and strange that a raccoon stole my bicycle. I think that's proof positive, right now, that we live in a very special place that might have a diamond mine.
 Response: Yeah, and how would you explain a raccoon just getting up and riding a bike? Maybe Samantha and I should run away together and try to find the diamond mine.

Prompt: We are gathered here today and to celebrate the marriage of you and you. Does anyone have any objections? Please speak now.
 Response: Well, we don't like to put labels on it.

Prompt: God, it is filled with blood. And somehow it's overflowing.
 Response: And, I gotta say this again, I'm just a social media manager, but you pick up a lot about the fish stuff when you're, you know, managing these accounts. Some of this is manatee blood. Most of it, and this is gonna sound crazy but I promise you this is true. It's sea horse blood.

Prompt: Do you have a little neck rash? It looks like something's irritated your neck.
 Response: Hurry. Okay. I'll stack the rest of these peach cans in front of it.

Prompt: Agent Thompson, get in the office right now.
 Response: Hank Thompson? I've heard of him.

Prompt: How're you doing, Mrs. Sinclair?
 Response: Well, I'm fine ever since you broke my daughter's heart and sent her down a trajectory of, well, you're looking at it.

Prompt: OK, it's the big day guys. Yorgy, how is the juggling coming along with Rubber Band?
 Response: He's a quick learner, papa.

Prompt: I've already gotten started, hope that's OK.
 Response: Yes, uh, you didn't need to. The robe should be closed until I say it's time to disrobe, but. That's OK.

Prompt: In fairness, he's just a guy doing his job.?
 Response: The perfect yin and yang to each other.

Prompt: Well, this child is now inflicted with a new disorder. It's traumatic soap opera amnesia. There's no cure.
 Response: This is so much worse than if he had no relationship with his father.

Prompt: That's right. Believe you can fly with your new wings.
 Response: Oh, wow, I'm doing it. Bye!

Prompt: It's hard to take you seriously, I can see the elastic on your beard. And also, you're so sweaty. It smells terrible in here.
 Response: And you brought in a bunch of archers and shot everyone who disagreed with you.
